input: sentence 1: Many people start to read Paul's books and can't put them down. They are gripped because Paul writes so well. [SEP] sentence 2: People are gripped because Paul writes so well.

sentence 1: No one joins Facebook to be sad and lonely. But a new study from the University of Wisconsin psychologist George Lincoln argues that that's exactly how it makes us feel. [SEP] sentence 2: That's exactly how the study makes us feel.

sentence 1: This morning, Joey built a sand castle on the beach, and put a toy flag in the highest tower, but this afternoon the wind knocked it down. [SEP] sentence 2: This afternoon the wind knocked The flag down.
sentence 1: The sculpture rolled off the shelf because it wasn't anchored. [SEP] sentence 2: The shelf wasn't anchored.

sentence 1: Grant worked hard to harvest his beans so he and his family would have enough to eat that winter, His friend Henry let him stack them in his barn where they would dry. Later, he and Tatyana would shell them and cook them for their Sunday dinners. [SEP] sentence 2: His friend Henry let him stack Grant and his family in his barn where they would dry.

sentence 1: Always before, Larry had helped Dad with his work. But he could not help him now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in the office. [SEP] sentence 2: Dad could not help him now.
